intro: Panicum nitidum var. ramulosum, commonly known as silky panicgrass, is a grass species native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny, two-lobed spikelets. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or disturbed areas. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and landscaping.
